title: These three words show why Labour are doomed under Jeremy Corbyn
text:
Three words. Just three little words. That’s all they were. And yet somehow, they summed up the state of the Labour party to a tee.

Jeremy Corbyn had just finished giving a speech in Northampton to a room of his most ardent local fans. They’d cheered and whooped with a passion that verged on the rapturous. Then came time for questions. A journalist from the Guardian raised his hand.

If My Corbyn lost the next general election, asked the man from the Guardian, would he resign?

The room bristled with indignation. And then came those three little words.

“Why should he?” snapped one supporter.

“Why should he?” echoed another.

Before we go on, I suppose we should at least consider the possibility...
